events.description:
On 29 October, we invite all local families and community members to come and lay a tribute in a memorial to all the people and places on the frontlines of the climate crisis.

This will be a simple memorial that celebrates the resilience and resistance of all those fighting against the injustice of climate change. It will be a chance to commemorate all the things, people and places we love that we stand to lose if world leaders don't get their act together and keep fossil fuels in the ground so we can limit global heating to 1.5C.  

You are invited to come down at 6pm to lay your own creative tributes, personal items, flowers or a lantern (we suggest fairylights in a jar instead of candles in case of rain). We will try to keep this memorial in place and gather to light again each evening until the end of COP26 when world leaders are meeting in Glasgow for last-ditch climate talks.  

Check out defundclimatechaos.uk for a guide and materials for making climate memorial lanterns. And please get in touch if you have creative ideas or are able to help set up and keep the memorial going!
events.title: Florence Park Climate Justice Memorial

embed.error: Couldn't find Event with uuid = a4aebc79-617d-4700-9736-0a6973c9a5b3

events.description:
Throughout the day on October 29, people will be taking bold, creative actions in the City of London and elsewhere outside the UK banks and insurers still funding the climate crisis.  Together we’ll be laying the blame squarely at the doorsteps of the worst fossil fuel financiers.

As the day closes and dusk draws in, we invite everyone to regroup and join us outside the Bank of England to co-create a powerful National Climate Justice Memorial and demand that the UK stops funding climate chaos immediately.  

We invite you to bring along and lay your own tributes to loved ones in communities here and around the world who are fighting the injustices of rising floods, wildfires and superstorms.  

On the eve of the COP26 climate talks, we’ll hear the voices and demands of frontline communities, Pacific Climate Warriors and youth activists, for the UK to lead the world in bold climate action by ending the financing of fossil fuels for good.
events.title: National Climate Justice Memorial

embed.error: Couldn't find Event with uuid = baca8706-eb71-44c9-bb6a-1a13dceec04d

events.description:
Come and join our Newcastle climate memorial on #DefundClimateChaos Global day of action.

As people globally face the consequences of the climate crisis, we will come together to demand care and repair at Lloyd’s of London insurance company Chubb Insurance. Join us to bring to life the memories of every person harmed by the injustices of the climate crisis.

We want to shed light on Lloyd’s of London's appalling environmental record, and the colonialist practices Lloyd’s wealth grew from. From the insurance of slave ships, to the insurance of climate-destroying projects that dispossess indigenous peoples of their land, Lloyd’s have blood on their hands.

.Through the memorial we will bring to life the memories of every person harmed by the injustices of the climate crisis. As people globally face extreme and destructive weather, we will come together to demand care and repair with them.
events.title: Chubb Insurance - Climate Justice Memorial

events.description:
On the eve of UN climate talks in Glasgow, people-powered actions and climate justice memorials will make it clear - in location and message alike - at whose doorstep the blame for the loss and damage of climate injustice lies.

On October 29, people around the world are joining together to demand that bankers, insurers and fund managers Defund Climate Chaos.

It’s past time to turn off the money pipeline to oil, coal and gas companies and start investing in climate justice and a safer future for us all.

Join youth strikers from twenty countries on the frontline on climate impacts, to demand Standard Chartered stop funding fossil fuels. Standard Chartered is a global funder of fossil fuels, financing US$31.4bn to the fossil fuel sector since the Paris Agreement was signed.
events.title: Standard Chartered - Youth Strike to Defund Climate Chaos

events.description:
On the eve of UN climate talks in Glasgow, people-powered actions and climate justice memorials will make it clear - in location and message alike - at whose doorstep the blame for the loss and damage of climate injustice lies. On October 29, people around the world are joining together to demand that bankers, insurers and fund managers #DefundClimateChaos.

It’s past time to turn off the money pipeline to oil, coal and gas companies and start investing in climate justice and a safer future for us all.

As the UK's biggest financer of coal, and Europe's largest funder of fossil fuel infrastructure, Barclays is pouring cash directly into the industry most responsible for driving climate chaos.

Join campaigners at Barclays HQ at 3pm on October 29 to demand an end to their funding of the climate crisis.

address_lines: 1 Churchill Place, Cabot Square, Canary Wharf

events.title: Barclays Climate Justice Memorial
